result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Holly M Perkins

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Case is dismissed as Defn has successfully completed FOP.
FOP Contract rcv'd; Contract to terminate on 07/06/16
and returned

Reporter: Melanie Nelson
  Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed.  Def entered a plea of guilty to Counts 3 & 4. Court accepted def's plea but w/h adjudication and referred def to FOP. Bail amended.

AMENDED SIGNATURE BOND - CONDITIONS MODIFIED
Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant must participate in Vivitrol Program.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not be at any pawn shops or resale stores.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $500.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
Trial Judge - Br 2
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-22-2015 09:00 am
Reset plea
amended;  Atty Murali Jasti
posted at Belleville PD on 8-25-15
Def is terminated from BMP. Cash bail is reinstated in the amount of $500 per case. BMP is removed as condition.
Granting Attorney Sam Wayne's Motion to Withdraw as Counsel for Defendant Holly Perkins
to defn, ADA Cardona, SPD;  of Motion to Withdraw and Affidavit in support of Withdrawal of Atty Sam Wayne
of Atty Sam Wayne in Support of his Motion to Withdraw as Counsel
Atty Sam Wayne
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 9, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
set Plea/Sentencing in 30 days
Bail Monitoring Program Out-Of-State Travel Request
Atty Sam Wayne
Final pre-trial on July 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not be at any pawn shops or resale stores.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per case on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If defendant fails to comply with DCBM, cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $500.00 (per case), as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. BMP is removed as condition of bond.
Trial Judge - Br 2

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Adrienne E. Blais appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 09:30 am.
